speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: SCENE II. The Earl of Gloucester's castle.

speaker: GONERIL
text_entry: Enter EDMUND, with a letter

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Thou, nature, art my goddess; to thy law

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: My services are bound. Wherefore should I

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Stand in the plague of custom, and permit

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: The curiosity of nations to deprive me,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: For that I am some twelve or fourteen moon-shines

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Lag of a brother? Why bastard? wherefore base?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: When my dimensions are as well compact,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: My mind as generous, and my shape as true,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: As honest madam's issue? Why brand they us

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: With base? with baseness? bastardy? base, base?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Who, in the lusty stealth of nature, take

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: More composition and fierce quality

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Than doth, within a dull, stale, tired bed,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Go to the creating a whole tribe of fops,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Got 'tween asleep and wake? Well, then,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Legitimate Edgar, I must have your land:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Our father's love is to the bastard Edmund

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: As to the legitimate: fine word,--legitimate!

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Well, my legitimate, if this letter speed,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: And my invention thrive, Edmund the base

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Shall top the legitimate. I grow; I prosper:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Now, gods, stand up for bastards!

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Kent banish'd thus! and France in choler parted!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And the king gone to-night! subscribed his power!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Confined to exhibition! All this done

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Upon the gad! Edmund, how now! what news?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: So please your lordship, none.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Putting up the letter

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Why so earnestly seek you to put up that letter?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I know no news, my lord.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What paper were you reading?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Nothing, my lord.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: No? What needed, then, that terrible dispatch of

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: it into your pocket? the quality of nothing hath

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: not such need to hide itself. Let's see: come,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: if it be nothing, I shall not need spectacles.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I beseech you, sir, pardon me: it is a letter

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: from my brother, that I have not all o'er-read;

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: and for so much as I have perused, I find it not

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: fit for your o'er-looking.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Give me the letter, sir.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I shall offend, either to detain or give it. The

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: contents, as in part I understand them, are to blame.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let's see, let's see.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I hope, for my brother's justification, he wrote

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: this but as an essay or taste of my virtue.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: [Reads]  'This policy and reverence of age makes

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: the world bitter to the best of our times; keeps

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: our fortunes from us till our oldness cannot relish

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: them. I begin to find an idle and fond bondage

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: in the oppression of aged tyranny; who sways, not

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: as it hath power, but as it is suffered. Come to

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: me, that of this I may speak more. If our father

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: would sleep till I waked him, you should half his

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: revenue for ever, and live the beloved of your

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: brother, EDGAR.'

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Hum--conspiracy!--'Sleep till I waked him,--you

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: should enjoy half his revenue,'--My son Edgar!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Had he a hand to write this? a heart and brain

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: to breed it in?--When came this to you? who

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: brought it?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: It was not brought me, my lord; there's the

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: cunning of it; I found it thrown in at the

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: casement of my closet.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: You know the character to be your brother's?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: If the matter were good, my lord, I durst swear

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: it were his; but, in respect of that, I would

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: fain think it were not.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: It is his.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: It is his hand, my lord; but I hope his heart is

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: not in the contents.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Hath he never heretofore sounded you in this business?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Never, my lord: but I have heard him oft

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: maintain it to be fit, that, sons at perfect age,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: and fathers declining, the father should be as

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: ward to the son, and the son manage his revenue.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: O villain, villain! His very opinion in the

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: letter! Abhorred villain! Unnatural, detested,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: brutish villain! worse than brutish! Go, sirrah,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: seek him; I'll apprehend him: abominable villain!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Where is he?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I do not well know, my lord. If it shall please

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: you to suspend your indignation against my

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: brother till you can derive from him better

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: testimony of his intent, you shall run a certain

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: course; where, if you violently proceed against

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: him, mistaking his purpose, it would make a great

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: gap in your own honour, and shake in pieces the

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: heart of his obedience. I dare pawn down my life

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: for him, that he hath wrote this to feel my

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: affection to your honour, and to no further

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: pretence of danger.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Think you so?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: If your honour judge it meet, I will place you

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: where you shall hear us confer of this, and by an

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: auricular assurance have your satisfaction; and

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: that without any further delay than this very evening.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: He cannot be such a monster--

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Nor is not, sure.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To his father, that so tenderly and entirely

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: loves him. Heaven and earth! Edmund, seek him

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: out: wind me into him, I pray you: frame the

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: business after your own wisdom. I would unstate

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: myself, to be in a due resolution.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I will seek him, sir, presently: convey the

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: business as I shall find means and acquaint you withal.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: These late eclipses in the sun and moon portend

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: no good to us: though the wisdom of nature can

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: reason it thus and thus, yet nature finds itself

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: scourged by the sequent effects: love cools,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: friendship falls off, brothers divide: in

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: cities, mutinies; in countries, discord; in

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: palaces, treason; and the bond cracked 'twixt son

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: and father. This villain of mine comes under the

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: prediction; there's son against father: the king

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: falls from bias of nature; there's father against

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: child. We have seen the best of our time:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: machinations, hollowness, treachery, and all

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: ruinous disorders, follow us disquietly to our

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: graves. Find out this villain, Edmund; it shall

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: lose thee nothing; do it carefully. And the

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: noble and true-hearted Kent banished! his

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: offence, honesty! 'Tis strange.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exit

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: This is the excellent foppery of the world, that,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: when we are sick in fortune,--often the surfeit

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: of our own behavior,--we make guilty of our

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: disasters the sun, the moon, and the stars: as

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: if we were villains by necessity; fools by

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: heavenly compulsion; knaves, thieves, and

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: treachers, by spherical predominance; drunkards,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: liars, and adulterers, by an enforced obedience of

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: planetary influence; and all that we are evil in,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: by a divine thrusting on: an admirable evasion

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: of whoremaster man, to lay his goatish

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: disposition to the charge of a star! My

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: father compounded with my mother under the

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: dragon's tail; and my nativity was under Ursa

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: major; so that it follows, I am rough and

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: lecherous. Tut, I should have been that I am,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: had the maidenliest star in the firmament

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: twinkled on my bastardizing. Edgar--

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Enter EDGAR

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: And pat he comes like the catastrophe of the old

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: comedy: my cue is villanous melancholy, with a

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: sigh like Tom o' Bedlam. O, these eclipses do

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: portend these divisions! fa, sol, la, mi.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: How now, brother Edmund! what serious

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: contemplation are you in?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I am thinking, brother, of a prediction I read

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: this other day, what should follow these eclipses.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Do you busy yourself about that?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I promise you, the effects he writes of succeed

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: unhappily; as of unnaturalness between the child

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: and the parent; death, dearth, dissolutions of

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: ancient amities; divisions in state, menaces and

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: maledictions against king and nobles; needless

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: diffidences, banishment of friends, dissipation

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: of cohorts, nuptial breaches, and I know not what.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: How long have you been a sectary astronomical?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Come, come; when saw you my father last?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Why, the night gone by.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Spake you with him?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Ay, two hours together.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Parted you in good terms? Found you no

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: displeasure in him by word or countenance?

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: None at all.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Bethink yourself wherein you may have offended

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: him: and at my entreaty forbear his presence

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: till some little time hath qualified the heat of

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: his displeasure; which at this instant so rageth

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: in him, that with the mischief of your person it

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: would scarcely allay.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Some villain hath done me wrong.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: That's my fear. I pray you, have a continent

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: forbearance till the spied of his rage goes

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: slower; and, as I say, retire with me to my

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: lodging, from whence I will fitly bring you to

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: hear my lord speak: pray ye, go; there's my key:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: if you do stir abroad, go armed.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Armed, brother!

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Brother, I advise you to the best; go armed: I

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: am no honest man if there be any good meaning

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: towards you: I have told you what I have seen

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: and heard; but faintly, nothing like the image

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: and horror of it: pray you, away.

speaker: EDGAR
text_entry: Shall I hear from you anon?

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: I do serve you in this business.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Exit EDGAR

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: A credulous father! and a brother noble,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Whose nature is so far from doing harms,

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: That he suspects none: on whose foolish honesty

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: My practises ride easy! I see the business.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Let me, if not by birth, have lands by wit:

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: All with me's meet that I can fashion fit.

speaker: EDMUND
text_entry: Exit
